note: Buddhism must have penetrated into Nepal early, but the kingdom became Buddhist in the sixth century, and the first Buddhist king of Thibet sent for scriptures from India' in 632 A ..D.
title: "l As early as the second century B.C., Buddhist books were taken to the Emperor of China, probably from Kashmir. Another emperor, in- 62 A.D., procured more Buddhist works, and Buddhism spread rapidly from that date until it became the state religion in the fourth century. . From ·China Buddhism spread to Korea in 372 A.D., and thence to Japan in 552 A.:f'. Kochin-China, Formosa, Mongolia, and other places received Buddhism from China .in the fourth and fifth centuries j' while from Kabul the religion travelled to Yashkand, .13alk, Bokhara, and other places
